Description: Fragment of oval handle, rising to sharp turn, of Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Rectangular stamp. Clay fine pink-buff; red core; cream slip.
Curator's comments: Name Xenophanes. Probably same as Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), 31, 22, though Petrie did not recognise the relatively clear beginning.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0863)
